emr 0.1.0
  • Reference

Convert a data.frame to array format.

df_to_array.Rd

Convert a data.frame to array format.

df_to_array(df, indexes)

Arguments

df

A data.frame with the indexes columns and a value column.
indexes

A names list with the indexes for the array.

Value

An array with the indexes dimension.

Examples

library(emr)

set1 <- c("A", "B")
set2 <- c("C", "D")
set3 <- c("imp", "exp")
sets <- list(
 set1 = set1,
 set2 = set2,
 set3 = set3
)
x <- expand.grid(
  set1 = set1,
  set2 = set2,
  set3 = set3,
  stringsAsFactors = TRUE
)
x$value <- 1:8
df_to_array(x, sets[(c('set1', 'set2', 'set3'))])
#> , , set3 = imp
#> 
#>     set2
#> set1 C D
#>    A 1 3
#>    B 2 4
#> 
#> , , set3 = exp
#> 
#>     set2
#> set1 C D
#>    A 5 7
#>    B 6 8
#>
